qas.question: Where was Popper's academic appointment in New Zealand?

answers.text: Canterbury University College of the University of New Zealand

qas.question: Which lifelong friend did Popper make in Dunedin?
What philosophical fields did Popper teach at the London School of Economics?
Which Austrian school's failure to give Popper a directorship prompted him to return to the United Kingdom at the end of his life?
What year did Popper become a lecturer in biology?

plausible_answers.text: The Open Society and its Enemies

qas.question: What was the title of John Carew Eccles's influential work?
What month was Popper's wife born in?
What year did John Carew Eccles move to the United Kingdom?
What university was Popper appointed a professor of astronomy at?

context: In <b5_0>1937<b5_0/>, Popper finally managed to get a position that allowed him to emigrate to <a0_0>New Zealand<a0_0/>, where he became lecturer in philosophy at <a1_0>Canterbury University College of the University of New Zealand<a1_0/> in Christchurch. It was here that he wrote his influential work <b6_0>The Open Society and its Enemies<b6_0/>. In Dunedin he met the Professor of Physiology <a2_0>John Carew Eccles<a2_0/> and formed a lifelong friendship with him. In 1946, after the Second World War, he moved to the United Kingdom to become reader in <a3_0>logic and scientific method<a3_0/> at the London School of Economics. Three years later, in 1949, he was appointed professor of logic and scientific method at the <b9_0>University of London<b9_0/>. Popper was president of the Aristotelian Society from 1958 to 1959. He retired from academic life in 1969, though he remained intellectually active for the rest of his life. In <b8_0>1985<b8_0/>, he returned to Austria so that his wife could have her relatives around her during the last months of her life; she died in <b7_0>November<b7_0/> that year. After the <a4_0>Ludwig Boltzmann Gesellschaft<a4_0/> failed to establish him as the director of a newly founded branch researching the philosophy of science, he went back again to the United Kingdom in 1986, settling in Kenley, Surrey.
